newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Mosaic gas well shows up to 24 BCF reserves.
newsitem.headline: Mosaic gas well shows up to 24 BCF reserves.

text.p: Australian oil and gas company Mosaic Oil NL said on Monday that engineering and geological studies indicated initial recoverable gas reserves of up to 24 billion cubic feet (BCF) in the onshore Downlands gasfield in the Surat Basin of Queensland.
The studies stemmed from production tests at the Downlands-2 gas well, Mosaic said.

The Downlands gasfield has two roughly equal culminations, which are most likely joined, Mosaic said. Depending on whether one or both are filled with gas, initial recoverable reserves estimates range from 10 BCF to 24 BCF, it said.
"Gas analyses indicate 1.9 tonnes of LPG and 3.7 barrels of condensate per million cubic feet of gas. There are no significant impurities in the gas," Mosaic said.

Mosaic, the operator of the Bainbilla Block of permit ATP471P in which Downlands is located, said the joint venture had approved seismic work on the Downlands structure and on structures just to the south.

It also said that seismic work was being considered over two structures in the south-west corner of the permit, and that commercial feasibility studies concerning the Downlands gas discovery were being undertaken.
Mosaic has a 28.889 percent interest in the well, OGM Development Pty Ltd has 42.222 percent, Santos Ltd 16.667 percent and Petroz NL 12.222 percent.
